title: fc891437.SERVERPLSG2E.fc1.001

backText: Cable management arms are used to keep the cables organized while sliding the server out of the rack for maintenance

frontText: When planning for the Active Directory database, how much additional space should you have above the size of the ntds.dit file?
backText: Additional space equal to 20% of the size of the ntds.dit file

title: fc891437.SERVERPLSG2E.fc1.059
frontText: List one advantage of iSCSI.
backText:
Possible answers:
  • iSCSI is simple, due to its reliance on Ethernet, which is well known.
  • iSCSI eliminates distance limitations imposed by SCSI transfers.
  • iSCSI is inexpensive in simple deployments.

title: fc891437.SERVERPLSG2E.fc1.070
frontText: What is the primary benefit of DDR3 over DDR2 ?
backText: DDR3 transfers data at twice the rate of DDR2.

title: fc891437.SERVERPLSG2E.fc1.071
frontText: What component is failing when you hear the click of death?

title: fc891437.SERVERPLSG2E.fc1.072
frontText: What is a kernel panic?
backText: An action taken by system’s kernel upon detecting an internal error in which either it is unable to safely recover or continuing to run the system would have a higher risk of major data loss.
